definition: KOIKE Yuriko (1952-), Japanese LDP politician, minister of defense during 2008
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
Abe Shinzo (1954-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2006-2007 and from 2012
MORI Yoshirō (1937-), Japanese rugby player and politician, prime minister 2000-2001, famous for numerous gaffes
KOIZUMI Jun'ichirō (1942-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2001-2006
Noda Yoshihiko, Prime Minister of Japan (2 September 2011 ~)
Ishihara Jintarō (1932-), Japanese author and politician, governor of Tokyo since 1999
KAN Naoto (1946-), Japanese Democratic Party politician, prime minister 2010-2011
ASŌ Tarō (1940-), Japanese entrepreneur and LDP politician, prime minister from 2008
